alert.note: Alert for Crockett; Sutton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 27 at 4:29PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN CROCKETT AND SOUTHWESTERN SUTTON COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM CDT... At 428 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles southeast of The Intersection Of Highway 163 And Ranch Road 1973, or 17 miles northeast of Juno, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Crockett and southwestern Sutton Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
